The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group
Dear Parents,
We hope that you have enjoyed a restful week with slightly later morning starts. We enter another busy half term that will of course culminate in Christmas celebrations in the final week. Please see the main dates for your diary below.
Nov. 8th 1A Class Assembly, 5A Class Assembly. Y1-6 Initial reports.
Nov 13th ASAs end
Nov. 15th 1B Class Assembly, 5B Class Assembly
Nov. 19th Parent and Teacher Consultations Y1-6 (4-6pm)
Nov. 20th Parent and Teacher Consultations Y1-6 (4-6pm)
Nov. 22nd 1C Assembly, 5C Assembly. EYFS initial reports.
Dec. 4th LC and UC Recital evenings
Dec. 10th Y3 production am, Parent and Teacher Consultations Y7-11 (4-6pm)
Dec. 11th Y6 production am, Y3 production pm, Parent/Teacher Consultations Y7-11 (4-6pm)
Dec. 12th ISM Swimming Gala Y1-3, Y6 production pm
Dec 16th Winter Art + Design week
Dec. 18th Christmas Carol Concert pm
Dec. 19th Class Christmas Celebrations
Dec 20th End of term, school ends noon
Story week
Story week has proved a great success this week, with our visiting author being a big hit with our EYFS and Primary Children. I hope that they have returned home each evening enthused about stories. Of course tomorrow offers the opportunity for the students to dress as a favourite character. We look forward to the costumes on show!
Half Term Trips
Not all students and staff have been relaxing during the break. Residential trips to Real Madrid (Football) and London (Expressive arts) have provided fantastic opportunities beyond the classroom. Both parties enjoyed remarkable experiences and returned tired but in the words of a student “with the memories of a lifetime”
Thanks to Mr. Hoult, Mr. Hamilton and Mr. Langford for leading the trips during their own free time.
Primary School Initial reports
Reports will be sent home with Year One to Six students next Friday. This initial report will indicate how students have started the year pastorally and academically and will be followed by more detailed academic reports in Term Two and Term Three. We hope that you enjoy the reports and look forward to the parent and teacher consultations that will follow.
Board Meeting – The British School of Kuala Lumpur
Mr. Seedhouse and Mr. Keach will be out of school next week, travelling to KL for the annual BSF board meeting.
The purpose of the meeting is to discuss and agree the main improvement plans for ISM in the next 12 months and beyond. Feedback from parents, students, staff and ISI will form the basis of these discussions.
Despite an excellent report from ISI that we will be able to share with you in the near future, it remains our ambition to continue to improve and become the best school that we can be. We will of course share our plans in due course.
Additionally the meeting offers an opportunity for Heads within our Foundation to share best practice supporting consistency and quality in all of our schools. I look forward to bringing back new ideas to our school.
I am pleased that a small group of students from our Senior Choir led by Mr. Langford will be accompanying us this year. They will be hosted by families in our sister school and have the opportunity to perform as part of a BSF ensemble at the end of the week. I am sure they will thoroughly enjoy this unique opportunity and act as great ambassadors for our school as always.
Have a wonderful weekend.
Paul Seedhouse
Headteacher
The International School of Moscow
